title: Phase 1: Add RpcProviderConfig types to data-models
description:
attached_molecule: da-wisp-qw44
attached_at: 2026-02-17T23:46:12Z
attached_args: SKIP PLAN MODE. Implement directly. Add RPC provider configuration types per the en-25w5 directive. Types: RpcProviderRole enum (primary/secondary/tertiary/emergency), RpcProviderType enum (managed/public/community), RpcEndpointConfig (url, wsUrl?, provider, role, type, rateLimitRps, timeoutMs, weight?), ChainRpcConfig (chainId, chainName, endpoints[], totalOperationTimeoutMs, cacheStaleAcceptanceMs), CircuitBreakerConfig (failureThreshold, openDurationMs, halfOpenMaxAttempts, monitorWindowMs), RetryConfig (maxAttempts, baseDelayMs, maxDelayMs), HealthCheckConfig (intervalMs, timeoutMs), RpcProviderConfig (top-level: chains, circuitBreaker, retry, healthCheck). Export from package. Follow TDD. Do NOT use EnterPlanMode.
dispatched_by: mayor

RPC fallback chain Phase 1 (per en-25w5 directive). Add these types to data-models:

- RpcProviderRole enum: primary, secondary, tertiary, emergency
- RpcProviderType enum: managed, public, community
- RpcEndpointConfig: url, wsUrl?, provider, role, type, rateLimitRps, timeoutMs, weight?
- ChainRpcConfig: chainId, chainName, endpoints[], totalOperationTimeoutMs, cacheStaleAcceptanceMs
- CircuitBreakerConfig: failureThreshold, openDurationMs, halfOpenMaxAttempts, monitorWindowMs
- RetryConfig: maxAttempts, baseDelayMs, maxDelayMs
- HealthCheckConfig: intervalMs, timeoutMs, method
- RpcProviderConfig (top-level): chains Record<string, ChainRpcConfig>, circuitBreaker, retry, healthCheck

This is the foundation — all downstream phases depend on these types. No runtime behavior, just type definitions.

Remove any require conditions added by PR da-pt7y. Ensure build passes and all tests pass after the change. Do NOT use EnterPlanMode.
dispatched_by: mayor

The data-models package should be ESM-only. PR merge/refinery/da-pt7y added CJS require conditions to the exports map. Remove all 'require' conditions from the exports map in package.json. This is a browser-first, client-side project — no CJS needed anywhere.

title: Phase 1B: Remove RPC infrastructure types from data-models
description:
attached_molecule: da-wisp-ju4k
attached_at: 2026-02-20T23:42:56Z
attached_args: SKIP PLAN MODE. Implement directly. P0 — Remove RPC infrastructure types from data-models. Per en-1mg1 analysis, these types belong in @cygnus-wealth/rpc-infrastructure (now created). REMOVE: RpcProviderRole, RpcProviderType, RpcEndpointConfig, ChainRpcConfig, RpcProviderConfig, CircuitBreakerConfig, RetryConfig, HealthCheckConfig, UserRpcEndpoint, UserRpcConfig, PrivacyConfig, and all related exports. KEEP all domain types (Portfolio, Asset, Balance, ChainId, etc). Bump version after changes. All existing tests must still pass.
dispatched_by: mayor

CLEANUP: Remove RPC infrastructure types that were incorrectly placed in data-models.

Per en-1mg1 architectural analysis, these types belong in @cygnus-wealth/rpc-infrastructure, not the shared kernel.

REMOVE from data-models:
- RpcProviderRole, RpcProviderType
- RpcEndpointConfig, ChainRpcConfig, RpcProviderConfig  
- CircuitBreakerConfig, RetryConfig, HealthCheckConfig
- UserRpcEndpoint, UserRpcConfig, PrivacyConfig
- All related exports

KEEP/ADD domain-appropriate chain identity types if not already present:
- ChainId, ChainIdentity, SupportedChain, AddressFormat, TokenStandard

These are legitimate domain model types that belong in the shared kernel.

DEPENDS ON Phase 1A (rpc-infrastructure package must exist first so nothing breaks).

Bump version after changes. Follow TDD.

title: Phase 1: Add decentralized RPC provider types to data-models
description:
attached_molecule: da-wisp-9e5f
attached_at: 2026-02-20T20:09:01Z
attached_args: SKIP PLAN MODE. Implement directly. P0 Phase 1 of en-tfkn (Decentralized RPC Provider Strategy). Add new types to data-models: extend RpcProviderType with 'decentralized' and 'user', add UserRpcEndpoint, UserRpcConfig, PrivacyConfig types, extend RpcProviderConfig with privacy and userOverrides fields. Reference EnterpriseArch mayor/rig/en-tfkn-decentralized-rpc-provider-strategy.md sections 4, 5, 6, 8. TDD — write tests first. Bump version after changes.
dispatched_by: mayor

Phase 1 of en-tfkn (Decentralized RPC Provider Strategy). Implements data-models type changes.

ADD to RpcProviderType enum: 'decentralized' and 'user' (alongside existing 'managed', 'public', 'community').

NEW TYPES:
- UserRpcEndpoint: { chainId: string, url: string, wsUrl?: string, label?: string }
- UserRpcConfig: { endpoints: UserRpcEndpoint[], mode: 'override' | 'prepend' }
- PrivacyConfig: { rotateWithinTier: boolean, privacyMode: boolean, queryJitterMs: number }

MODIFY RpcProviderConfig: add 'privacy: PrivacyConfig' and 'userOverrides?: UserRpcConfig' fields.

Reference: EnterpriseArch mayor/rig/en-tfkn-decentralized-rpc-provider-strategy.md sections 4, 5, 6, 8. Follow TDD.
close_reason: Types shipped to wrong package — architect ruled RPC types don't belong in data-models (en-1mg1)

title: Add getDeFiPositions() to BlockchainIntegrationContract and update data-models DeFi types
description:
attached_molecule: da-wisp-gs0a
attached_at: 2026-02-17T22:57:44Z
attached_args: SKIP PLAN MODE. Implement directly. Extend the DeFi position types that da-syn added. Ensure complete type coverage: DeFiPositionType enum (vault, lending_supply, lending_borrow, liquidity_pool, staking, farming, perp_position), DeFiProtocol enum (beefy, aave, uniswap, compound, lido, marinade, raydium, jupiter, orca), DeFiPosition interface with type/protocol/chain/underlyingAssets/value/apy/rewards/metadata, subtypes (VaultPosition, LendingPosition, LiquidityPosition, StakingPosition), and a discoverySource field to distinguish wallet_token_scan from contract_query. Check what da-syn already added first. Follow TDD. Do NOT use EnterPlanMode.
dispatched_by: mayor

Wave 4: Extend the DeFi position types in data-models per en-9qon architecture recommendation.

Ensure these types exist and are complete:
- DeFiPositionType enum: vault, lending_supply, lending_borrow, liquidity_pool, staking, farming, perp_position
- DeFiProtocol enum: beefy, aave, uniswap, compound, lido, marinade, raydium, jupiter, orca (extensible)
- DeFiPosition interface: type, protocol, chain, underlyingAssets[], value, apy, rewards[], metadata
- VaultPosition, LendingPosition, LiquidityPosition, StakingPosition subtypes
- DeFiDiscoverySource enum or field: wallet_token_scan vs contract_query (to track how position was discovered)

Check what da-syn already added and extend as needed. Ensure types support both discovery paths (receipt tokens in wallet AND positions found via contract state queries).

title: Add multi-wallet multi-account identity types
description:
attached_molecule: da-wisp-pac2
attached_at: 2026-02-19T19:24:39Z
attached_args: NEVER use EnterPlanMode — it WILL freeze your session. Implement directly with TDD. This is Phase 1 (P0) of the multi-wallet multi-account architecture (en-fr0z). Add all new identity types and update existing types as specified in the bead description. Reference EnterpriseArch/mayor/rig/en-fr0z-multi-wallet-multi-account-architecture.md sections 1 and 2 for full type definitions. Export all new types from the package index. Unit tests only, no E2E. START CODING IMMEDIATELY.
dispatched_by: mayor

Phase 1 of en-fr0z (multi-wallet multi-account architecture). Add all new canonical types to data-models:

NEW TYPES:
- WalletProviderId — string union: 'metamask', 'rabby', 'walletconnect', 'coinbase-wallet', 'trust-wallet', 'frame', 'crypto-com-onchain', 'phantom', 'solflare', 'backpack', 'exodus', 'manual'
- WalletConnectionId — format: {providerId}:{randomId}
- AccountId — format: {walletConnectionId}:{checksummedAddress} or watch:{checksummedAddress}
- WalletConnection — connectionId, providerId, providerName, providerIcon, connectionLabel, accounts[], activeAccountAddress, supportedChains, connectedAt, lastActiveAt, sessionStatus
- ConnectedAccount — accountId, address, accountLabel, chainScope, source ('provider'|'manual'), discoveredAt, isStale, isActive
- WatchAddress — accountId, address, addressLabel, chainScope, addedAt
- AccountGroup — groupId, groupName, accountIds[], createdAt
- TrackedAddress — accountId, address, walletConnectionId, providerId, accountLabel, connectionLabel, chainScope
- AccountMetadata — accountId, address, accountLabel, connectionLabel, providerId, walletConnectionId, groups[], discoveredAt, isStale, isActive
- AddressRequest — accountId, address, chainScope
- AccountPortfolio — accountId, accountLabel, walletConnectionId, providerName, assets[], totalValue, lastUpdated
- WalletPortfolio — walletConnectionId, connectionLabel, providerName, accounts[], totalValue
- GroupPortfolio — groupId, groupName, accounts[], totalValue, lastUpdated
- AccountSummary — accountId, accountLabel, connectionLabel, providerId, totalValue, assetCount, chains[], lastUpdated
- AssetDistribution — symbol, totalQuantity, totalValue, distribution[]
- AccountAssetEntry — accountId, accountLabel, connectionLabel, quantity, value, percentage
- AccountBalanceList, AccountBalance, AccountError — for account-attributed balance results

UPDATED TYPES:
- Portfolio — add accountBreakdown: Map<AccountId, AccountPortfolio>, walletBreakdown: Map<WalletConnectionId, WalletPortfolio>
- Asset — add accountId: AccountId, walletConnectionId: WalletConnectionId | 'watch'
- Transaction — add accountId: AccountId, walletConnectionId: WalletConnectionId | 'watch'
- DeFiPosition — add accountId: AccountId alongside existing ownerAddress
- IntegrationSource — add optional accountId?: AccountId
- TransactionFilter — add accountIds?, walletConnectionIds?, groupIds?

See EnterpriseArch/mayor/rig/en-fr0z-multi-wallet-multi-account-architecture.md for full spec. Follow TDD.
